data: q1h for 4 hour, q2h for 4 hour, then q4h if stable
QID if eating or q2h if NPO. Target glucose range: 4 to 12 mmol/L

Tube for feeding, Insert STAT unless J-tube is in place
Patient may insert their own NG Tube without X-ray
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Reason for Consult: Enteral Nutrition, On week-ends and statutory holidays, call the diet office to page on-call Dietitian between 8am and 4pm
Place sign over bed: Patient is unable to fast
3 meals and 3 snacks daily. Snacks and meals must be served q3h to avoid severe hypoglycemia
Options to Support Blood Sugar: Select EITHER Option 1, Option 2 or Option 3
Route: NG-tube, Patients on nocturnal feeds, ensure breakfast is served within 30 min of stopping the feed. If breakfast is delayed, continue the feed until breakfast arrives

Nutritional supplements: Other supplement, Special Instructions: Uncooked Corn Starch. _____g corn starch and _______mL cold water mixed together and taken at ________
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
